file_content.text: I see more ambushers on the way!
Maybe you can hold them off while my men and I make a run for it and deliver the prisoner to Lord Baras?
I'll cover you. Go!
Do it!
I suppose that's as good a plan as any.
Why not.
Leave the fighting for real fighters.
Wimps. Fine.
Come on, men--double-time!
All right, men, let's hurry up and get this hunk of carbonite to its owner.
Hey, Captain Oblivious--boo.
Oh, I--I didn't see you enter. Lord Baras didn't need to send a welcoming party.
Obviously, Lord Baras feels otherwise.
You don't decide such things.
I'm here to make sure you do your job.
Baras sent me to babysit.
I hardly think that's necessary.
You're lucky I'm not an enemy, or you'd all be dead.
I could have killed you.
Forgive me, my lord, but this is the capital world of the Empire.
My men and I have performed much more dangerous duties for Lord Baras.
The prisoner is frozen in carbonite, so he's not a flight risk--and this is friendly territory. Surely we're safe here.
Leave the figuring to Lord Baras.
Don't think.
Sith interests are complicated.
Trust me, you weren't.
There is no such thing as friendly territory.
Never leave your guard down.
No offense, my lord--that brand of paranoia may work for Lord Baras, but I don't subscribe to it.
When you're on assignment for us, you do.
Remedy that.
Yes, my lord. Whatever you say.
It's unfortunate, but we must humor the old man.
Personally, I agree.
Glad to find another sensible being here.
Which one of your men takes over after I kill you?
You're treading on thin ice.
Please, my lord, there's no need for talk like that. I heed your point.
Let's get this oversized block of ice to your master.
Not so fast. My master ordered that block of ice. So, step away from the carbonite man and no one ends up in a grave.
Your master is going to be disappointed.
Not going to happen.
Perhaps I didn't make myself plainly clear.
Who are you?
My name is of little importance.
This is a private party.
You're not welcome here.
Then consider it crashed.
I'm here to relieve you of your burden. Whether that includes your own lives as well, is up to you.
Lookie lookie, if it ain't Slestack. Your master be wanting the froze man, too, huh? Too bad for you. It mine.
Too bad for both of you.
No, it's mine.
Ah, quite a popular trophy. The competition should be fierce.
If you not flee, you about to learn fierce, Slestack.
You two know each other?
Friends of yours?
To know TuMarr is to hate TuMarr.
That go true for you too, Slestack. If you don't flee, this be like killing two stone with one bird.
I think introductions are in order.
Tell me who you are.
Fine. I am Slestack and this ignoramus is TuMarr. My master and the slime TuMarr takes orders from don't exactly like each other.
My slime crush your master with pinky.
I'm such a fool. I'll never doubt Lord Baras again. What do we do?
Don't panic.
Relax.
On their own, TuMarr and his lackeys wouldn't be much of a fight.
You mouth always get you in trouble, Slestack. It about to chew off more than it can bite.
You going to take that, Slestack?
Sounds like a challenge.
I'd like to see you prove it, TuMarr.
Can you back that up?
These gents look reasonable. We'll reason with them.
Let's talk.
TuMarr and his mates can't even spell "reasonable."
All me gotta be able to spell is kill. K-Y-Y-Y-L.
Did you come here to chat or fight?
Are you all talk?
You can spell it, now prove you can do it.
Can you back that up?
Yeah, I prove it, Sith. Boys, first we beat Slestack, then do job!
There it is, then. A fight for the right to raid the landing party. Won't take but a moment, instigator.
He convinced me. I think TuMarr can kill you, Slestack.
Sounds like a challenge.
Very amusing. I do relish the opportunity to rid the world of TuMarr and his drones. So I'll be with you presently, instigator.
Come on, boys, we smash the talk from Slestack's big mouth now!
Well done! While they fight, my men and I will deliver the prisoner to Lord Baras. Thank you for buying us time, my lord.
Let's go, guys!
Yeah, let's get out of here!
We kill them all.
We kill.
I know you're Sith, stranger--but I think your bravado is ill-advised.
Me got idea, Slestack. How about we play wishbone with the talker? Bigger half get the spoils.
A truce, then. You stood a chance against one set of us, Sith--but even a master Force user can't beat these odds.
Make your move. It's your funeral.
I'm warning you.
No, it's my funeral parlor. Attack!
Time to roll the dice, then! Attack!
I beg to differ! [Attack]
I'm going to kill you and eat you all raw!
I'm a monster. [Intimidate]
Eat me? Me hear right, this Sith say he eat me?
Yes, I heard that as well. Do you really mean to eat us if you kill us?
And then pick my teeth with your bones!
Yes, until I'm bloated!
I don't know about my brutish counterpart, but my men and I yield.
It's just a figure of speech.
Of course not.
Ah. Well, all right, then. Men, attack!
Time for killin', boys!
Sure, don't you eat what you kill?
Of course.
Uh, not the peoples me kills.
I don't get paid enough to fight a monster. I take my leave of you, Sith.
Me not want to be breakfast either. We leave, boys.
Run. Quickly.
You don't have to tell me twice.
Don't gotta tell me once.
Goodbye, Sith. I hope our paths don't cross again.
A wise choice, both of you.
Smart.
It's a day of firsts, then--a merciful Sith and TuMarr being called "wise."
That true. What it mean, "wise"?
I'll explain it to you later, brute.
Well done. I can't believe they bought a bluff like that--they really thought you'd eat them.
I'm not here for idle chatter.
Cut the small talk.
Of course, my lord. We have business to complete.
Don't always need to fight.
You're much more versatile than the average Sith, my lord.
That was no bluff.
I was serious.
Oh, I see. Well then....
My men and I better be getting this cargo to Darth Baras. Thanks for your help.
Too late for backing out!
I prefer to kill. [Attack]
Every man for himself!
